question.text: Case: A lady is 15 weeks pregnant. Various tests confirm that if her child was born, it would suffer from a serious illness leading to a serious handicap. What is the best-suggested option to this case as per the Medical Termination of Pregnancy (Amendment) Act, 2017?

options.text: MTP can be easily performed without any restrictions
MTP can be performed only if two registered medical practitioners agree to it
MTP can be performed only after determination of sex of the baby

solution.text:
According to The Medical Termination of Pregnancy (Amendment) Act, 2017:
(a) MTP can be done within the first 12 weeks of pregnancy on the opinion of one registered medical practitioner.
(b) MTP can be done between 12–24 weeks of pregnancy on the opinion of two registered medical practitioners.

MTP can be performed when the continuation of pregnancy:
(I) would involve a risk to the life of the pregnant woman or
(II) There is a substantial risk to the child
